heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 06 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (182°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 52.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The highest wind speed ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.9°C) and outside temperature (up 2.7°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%) and rainfall (up 0.2 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 784 m) and light levels (up 4112 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.3 mm), cloud levels (up 918 m), and light levels (up 3121 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 783.7m lower than yesterday, 100.3m lower than the past week, 917.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 737m minimum and 4780m maximum, with an average of 1610.1m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1710.4m and 2530m.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, intensely sticky air and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
